topic.title: Play source code
topic.body:
I want to improve Play website. But I don't find the sources anywhere. No repo on github, neither on gitlab.
Is there a repo where I can make pull requests somewhere ?

1_1JwPBvZYXLJzrA6YisjpsyTuuieFLCARS6.body: Yes but improve the online version would have been better than creating my own one. I hope a repo will be available when zerogit will be there.

> [mnnstory](#comment_3_14tnrN3dbjc7t5ZbRxT2Vi8CbC4uoqZrFh): The source code is on your compuer.

I love the way you didn't read the question.

1_139X4c3WFVtmsEj6Vpdd74YY49ettpduKq.body:
Of course there are.
Here is the list: http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:zite-list-searches

17_1CMjV2r4EBpFt8VCcWWZKDysZXPcPExRNN.body:
> [genericusername](#comment_11_14ng1wByxwoNXAhihYbpgyarVJbFiqs8ny): It's not WYSIWYG but uses markdown which is a very simple markup language based off of ascii email (See here).

It's not a markup language (it's the origin of its name "markDOWN").

10_1KdnTJVBGzEZrJppFZtzfG9chukuMv8xSb.body:
I tried to used a zeroverse account and got the error "Content publish failed.", so I cannot even create a profile (I can create one, but it's not sent through the network).
However, it works well using zeroid.
Nice work :)

1_1Mxv7my8HRBiVNRtiFaHrrbb11hmPqa6qL.body:
It worked correctly with me.
What is your problem exactly ?
